S1 : China is now a member of world trade organization . As a member of TO , China will have to make some changes in its economic policies so that it can follow the routines practiced by other TO members . Is it fair to China , do you think ?
S2 : It 's a hard question , but I 'm sure the reexamination of China 's economic policies in the past may lead us to a right answer to the question . After the establishment of new China , our government employed numerous economics policies to stimulate the growth of China 's economy . These policies , however , favored our domestic enterprises and protected them from international competition and these policies have contributed a lot to the rapid growth of both China economy and our domestic enterprises . After China 's entry into TO , Chinese domestic enterprises will have to compete with their foreign counterparts . This new situation entails some changes of Chinese economic policies . These changes will spur Chinese enterprises to strengthen their competitiveness in the long run .
S1 : We can infer that the non-discrimination principle is one of the most important principles of TO agreement . This principle requires equal treatment of domestic and foreign enterprise . Does the principle also apply to domestic enterprise of different ownerships ?
S2 : Yes , it does . Domestic enterprises of different ownerships enjoy equal rights for the non-discrimination principle grants equal rights to enterprises , regardless of their nationality and ownership . I have found that although changes of China 's economic policies are numerous , these changes are largely based on the most important economic principle ot TO agreement - non-discrimination principle . Such an understanding of principle of the changes may help us not only to have a good insight into the changes but also to foresee the tendency of the new changes of China 's economic policies .

S1 : He loves that blonde girl .
S2 : Yes , he once gave her seven roses .
S1 : Did she accept it ?
S2 : No way to know .

S1 : Bob 's sister will go to America .
S2 : Why tell me ? She has nothing to do with me !
S1 : I thought you wanted to know more about her .
S2 : No , I could n't care less !

S1 : How do you like other films starring Charlie Chaplin ?
S2 : Well , I like others very much , but I really do n't think much of this one .
S1 : You do n't like the performance , do you ?
S2 : Yes , but I do n't like the story .

S1 : I met Mark yesterday . He looked blue .
S2 : He ’ s been on the gravy train these years , hasn ’ t he ?
S1 : It belongs to the past . He lost his job the other day , and he ’ s up a tree now .
S2 : It seems that nobody can always expect things to pan out well each time .

S1 : How do you like Tom ?
S2 : I like him very much . He ’ s a gay dog .
S1 : Are you ready to welcome him ?
S2 : I am all set . He can come anytime .

S1 : My wife is really a chatter box . It ’ s so boring .
S2 : I have an idea .
S1 : What is it ?
S2 : You just turn a deaf ear when she talks .

S1 : Did you get the car you wanted ?
S2 : No . Someone had stolen a march on me and bought it .
S1 : What about the car over there ?
S2 : It is marvelous , and the price is marvelous , as well .

S1 : Is Jack still staying idle everyday ?
S2 : No , he has mended his way . After his father died , he set his hand to the job of putting his business affairs in order .
S1 : Really ? He is so competent now .
S2 : You can ’ t imagine what he is like now .

S1 : You look pale recently .
S2 : Yeah . I have got much pressure in the company . I have to be wrapped upon my work .
S1 : Take good care of yourself .
S2 : Thank you . I will .

S1 : What did the boss say to you ?
S2 : He asked me to beef up in the work .
S1 : Yeah . You look so unhappy recently . What ’ s the matter .
S2 : Nothing , thanks . I am just not in the mood these days .

S1 : Your husband is very helpful , is n't he ?
S2 : Willing to help , maybe , but not as helpful as you think .
S1 : Really ?
S2 : Last night he told the children acliff - hangerstory and both of them were scared out of sleep .

S1 : The stepmother was very wicked . She could n't stand a happy smile on the boy 's face .
S2 : And ?
S1 : And she did her best to pull out the thorn in her flesh and the boy lost whatever made him happy .
S2 : Poor child !

S1 : What a surprise meeting you here , Landy .
S2 : I ’ m here as a tourist .
S1 : It ’ s a small world , isn ’ t it ?
S2 : Yes , it ’ s a small world . We never know where we ’ ll meet someone we know .

S1 : Diana , do you like the perfume I gave you ?
S2 : It ’ s good . But to tell you the truth , I don ’ t wear perfume .
S1 : I ’ m sorry . I didn ’ t know that .
S2 : That ’ s all right . Thank you all the same .

S1 : I haven ’ t met Bob for years . How is he ?
S2 : He has been keeping bach after divorce .
S1 : He would have recovered from the stress and got married again .
S2 : Once bitten , twice shy . He said he would rather keep bach than to live in disgust .

object.tokens: he would rather keep bach than to live in disgust

dialogue:
S1 : It is obvious that their government is nursing the hope of having all other countries over a barrel and bring them completely under their control .
S2 : It ’ s a typical of them to do so .
S1 : What can we do ?
S2 : We must keep developing our economy and unite with other developing countries to fight against it .

S1 : Look out ! Your tea water is running over .
S2 : Oh , would you please turn off the fire ? My hands are sticky with the dough .
S1 : Sure .
S2 : Thanks .

S1 : I want to leave home , mum .
S2 : Why ?
S1 : I am a grown - up , and I can stand on my own two feet .
S2 : It is all up to you .

S1 : Is this the right bus for the Grand Hotel ?
S2 : Oh , no . You should take the No . 14 tram .
S1 : Where can I take it ?
S2 : Two blocks down the street .

S1 : How much shall I pay ?
S2 : Let me see . A roasted duck is 15 dollars . A plate of pork is 10 dollars . A bowl of beef is 6 dollars . Two bottles of beer are 3 dollars . That ' ll be a total of 34 dollars .
S1 : Here is 40 dollars . Keep the change , please .
S2 : Oh , sorry , sir . We take no tips here . Thank you all the same .

S1 : I don ’ t know what activity my son should take part in ?
S2 : Many children are learning drawing , dancing , swimming and so on in their spare time . You can follow suit .
S1 : But each children has his own interest .
S2 : Well , you should talk with your son and let him make his own decision .

S1 : What ? Your golden watch is lost ?
S2 : Yeah . I just ca n't find it anywhere .
S1 : It 's an open book that it was stolen by the man in black .
S2 : Let 's get it back .

S1 : Could you show me my bill ?
S2 : Here you are . That comes to 120 yuan .
S1 : Can I have it charged to my account , please ?
S2 : Certainly , sir . Would you sign here , please ? ... Thank you .

S1 : Do you have this design with only one breast pocket ?
S2 : Let me see . Oh , we have the design but not the same color as this one .
S1 : It 's a pity . I 'm afraid that 's too loud for me . Thank you .
S2 : You 're welcome .

S1 : Excuse me , is this taxi taken ?
S2 : No . May I help you ?
S1 : Would you please drive me to chinatown ?
S2 : Oh , that 's where I 'm going .

S1 : I like double - breasted garment with no belt . Could you show me some ?
S2 : Here you are . Which size do you wear ?
S1 : Medium . May I try it on ?
S2 : Of course . You look terrific in it !
coreferences_tokens: double - breasted garment with no belt

dialogue:
S1 : May I have a look at that vase , please ?
S2 : Of course . It 's the best one I have here --- and it 's only 300 yuan .
S1 : Oh , it 's really nice , but to tell the truth , that 's far too expensive .
S2 : Really ? Even for such an excellent one ?

S1 : Do you know the circulation of this magazine ?
S2 : You mean this month ?
S1 : Oh , yes , how 's it ?
S2 : Over 2 million .

S1 : My TV has n't got a clear picture recently . How ' s yours ?
S2 : It 's OK . I can always get a clear picture on it .
S1 : I think something is wrong with mine .
S2 : You 'd better have it fixed .

S1 : Would you mind telling me if this is the right way to the police station ?
S2 : I ’ m afraid you ’ re going in the opposite direction .
S1 : Should I take a bus ?
S2 : I think a cab is better .

S1 : Would you like a cup of coffee ?
S2 : No , thank you .
S1 : I 'm going to get one for myself . They make really good coffee here .
S2 : On second thought , I will have a cup .

S1 : Look out ! A small boy is rushing out blindly .
S2 : Gee , how dangerous ! I 've almost knocked him down .
S1 : You stopped just in time . Good for you !
S2 : I braked as hard as I could .

S1 : Saying you want to kill yourself , you terrified me out of my wits .
S2 : I was playing a joke on you .
S1 : That ’ s too much .
S2 : Dear , forgive me . I won ’ t do that again .

S1 : Finding an excuse is obviously down your alley . And trying to avoid taking care of the children is what you are good at .
S2 : Listen , Nancy . If I do n't work hard , I will be laid off .
S1 : You are passing the buck . I 'll be hanged if I ask you to go to the park with us .
S2 : Come on , Nancy . Play it cool . I go with you and burn the middle night oil tonight .

S1 : Bob , I 'm really upset with you .
S2 : I 'm sorry , I did n't mean to forget our wedding anniversary .
S1 : You forgot it last year as well .
S2 : I know , I 'm sorry .

S1 : I wish you would n't play the TV so loud .
S2 : Sorry . Were you trying to sleep ?
S1 : Yes , please ask when you want to borrow my records next time .
S2 : I 'm sorry . You 're right . I should have asked .

S1 : I 've been standing here since half past seven . Where on earth have you been ?
S2 : I 'm terribly sorry I 'm late . I just could n't help it .
S1 : It 's really very easy saying you 're sorry .
S2 : Look , just give me a chance . I can explain it .

S1 : I 'm sorry for spilling my drink on your rug .
S2 : There 's no need to apologize .
S1 : But I ruined your rug .
S2 : Forget it . It was an accident .

S1 : I do n't understand why some parents keep beefing and complaining about their daughters not being able to follow suit .
S2 : Yeah . Li Na 's mother has been building a fire under her since her neighbour 's daughter got married with a Canadian . She 's almost driving Li Na crazy .
S1 : If I were Li Na , I would ask her if she had done that .
S2 : She a as meek as a lamb . She never goes against anyone or anything . She 's as good as gold , you know ?

S1 : Did you see that ?
S2 : No , I missed it .
S1 : How could you miss that ?
S2 : Someone was in the way .

S1 : Will we drive to the seaside ?
S2 : Yes , it will take about four hours . We can leave about noon and get there by supper time .
S1 : Let me help pay for gas .
S2 : All right . There will be three of us going so we will each pay a third .
S1 : What other expenses will we have ?
S2 : There wo n't be many other expenses expect food .

S1 : Does your child still believe in Santa Claus ?
S2 : Yes . She believes everything about him .
S1 : How sweet .
S2 : Yes . If she does n't believe it , Christmas wo n't be so exciting to her .
S1 : When are you going to tell her that Santa Claus does n't exist ?
S2 : I 'm not going to tell her . She will find out and understand when she grows older .

S1 : I want to buy two tickets for tonight 's concert .
S2 : Sure . How do you like your seats ?
S1 : Ordinary one , please .
S2 : Ok , here are your tickets in Row 13 .
S1 : I think they are too far from the stage . I want two in row 6 .
S2 : That 's fine . But you have to pay another $ 10 .

S1 : Hey , Maggy , Did you hear about David ?
S2 : About David ? No , I didn ’ t hear anything .
S1 : You know , about David and his new boss .
S2 : Sorry , I don ’ t quite follow you .
S1 : Well , I heard David has been fired .
S2 : Oh , that is a shame . He is really hard working .

S1 : I am very interested in a new apartment near the Taxing Plaza , but the price is very high , I really ca n't afford it .
S2 : How much is it for each square meter ? How large is the apartment ?
S1 : It 's 7500 yuan per square meter , and I really like the one with three bedrooms and a large living room . Its total area is about 80 square meters .
S2 : That surely will cost you a lot of money . Are you going to make a full payment ?
S1 : Do you think I am rich enough to make it ? I am thinking about buying the apartment by installments . The real estate agency says if I pay a 25 % down payment , I can move in at once .
S2 : If sounds so tempting . Why not go applying for a loan from the bank ? They charge very low interest , so you can choose whether to pay up the balance in 10 or 20 years .

S1 : Hi , dear , I 've got your voice at last .
S2 : Hi , darling , I am thinking it is the time of your calling .
S1 : Are you OK today ?
S2 : Quite good except thinking of you so much .
S1 : So do I . You are a beautiful flower in my mind .
S2 : It 's called love is blind , I think .
